page.title: 07THE PRIMARY SCHOOL,HIGH HAM
page.content: Built in 1865, the school has 100 children aged 4-11 years divided into 4 classes. A fifth teacher works 4 mornings, and an ancilliary for 15 hours a week. School meals, swimming pool & cricket net are provided. Staff and parents have greatly improved the school and raise Â£2,000 each year, which matches the L.E.A. allocation. The curriculum is extensive, including several sports, French, dancing, computer & environmental studies, in addition to the basics. After school clubs are offered each evening in athletics,swimming,football,netball & cricket. Camps and trips are organised and a French class joins the school each year. Parents are encouraged to be partners in teaching the children. The Village School is dying out and is greatly respected & protected for all the advantages it gives the children.
